verses.text: Now after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and her towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought gifts.
And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to stablish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all the chariot \add horses\add*, but reserved of them an hundred chariots.
And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
Then David put \add garrisons\add* in Syria-damascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and brought gifts. Thus the \sc Lord\sc* preserved David whithersoever he went.
And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them \add to\add* Jerusalem.
Likewise from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, brought David very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brasen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah;

he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to inquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had war with Tou;) and \add with him\add* all \add manner of\add* vessels of gold and silver and brass.

Them also king David dedicated unto the \sc Lord\sc*, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all \add these\add* nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew of the Edomites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand.
And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David’s servants. Thus the \sc Lord\sc* preserved David whithersoever he went.
So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
And Joab the son of Zeruiah \add was\add* over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder.
And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, \add were\add* the priests; and Shavsha \add was\add* scribe;
and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada \add was\add* over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David \add were\add* chief about the king.
